column4: I have new 5.1 speakers with alsa running pretty well; but every twenty seconds or so I hear a short sound / click / hickup / whatever you call it, like you sometimes hear when you turn a radio on / off. It's not regular, and not always the same volume. What could it be? Hardware, software, config, where to look?
are you sure you are not hearing the default sound theme for ubuntu.. does it happen when you click buttons on certain windows?
I have sound theme disabled and it's not reacting on my actions I think
I am not so sure what might be causing this.. so you have any audible notifications enabled?
yes, with this channel for example in pidgin, works fine
so this happens just when the machine is sitting idle with no other applications running?
!ops
it happens all the time; when I'm doing something or when I just watch this channel flood by; doesn't matter, I don't see a pattern
how about when you are watching movies.. does it make these noises?
not sure, at least not recognizable
hmm
could it be that some audio / sound daemon starts / stops every time?
hmm
good point that could be it
pulse does switch off to to speak after a few minutes idle VCoolio
do you require pulse?
!pulse | VCoolio
hmm
what daemon is alsa? I tried disabling pulse audio as much as possible as it killed all sound
sec I will have a look
